text: HONG KONG, Jan 12 Hong Kong-based ORI Capital, an investment firm focusing on the healthcare sector, said on Tuesday it is targeting $400 million in a new fund.ORI Capital has already reached the first-close of the fund at $112 million with final completion of the fundraising by the end of 2021, a spokeswoman for the firm said.ORIs announcement comes a day after it agreed to sell portfolio company, British immunotherapy firm Kymab, to French drugmaker Sanofi for up to $1.5 billion.The new fund, ORIs second in healthcare, will double the size of its initial fund launched in 2016 if completed at its target size. (Reporting by Kane Wu; Editing by Alexander Smith)
